required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Pegtibatinase as an Enzyme Therapy for Patients With Homocystinuria Caused by Cystathionine Beta-Synthase Deficiency (COMPOSE)
clinical_study.official_title: A Double Blind, Randomized, Placebo-controlled, Phase 1/2 Study to Assess the Safety, Tolerability, Pharmacokinetics, Pharmacodynamics, and Effects on Clinical Outcomes of Pegtibatinase (TVT-058), Administered Subcutaneously in Patients With Cystathionine Beta-Synthase Deficient Homocystinuria (COMPOSE)

brief_summary.textblock:
Homocystinuria caused by Cystathionine Beta-Synthase (CBS) Deficiency is a rare autosomal-recessive metabolic condition characterized by an excess of homocysteine (Hcy) in the plasma, tissues and urine. It is due to reduced or absent activity of the CBS enzyme, and is also known as classical homocystinuria. The symptoms associated with homocystinuria are variable in severity and time of onset across patients. Some affected individuals may have mild signs of the disorder; others may have multi-systemic involvement including potentially life-threatening complications. Homocystinuria can affect many different organ systems of the body; the four most commonly involved are the eyes, central nervous system, skeleton, and the vascular system.
The current approaches to treatment of homocystinuria patients include a highly restrictive diet and use of dietary supplements. Lifetime compliance with this diet is poor. Pegtibatinase (TVT-058) represents a novel therapeutic approach that incorporates the use of a modified version of the native, human CBS (hCBS) enzyme. The goal of treatment is to introduce the CBS enzyme into circulation, resulting in reduced Hcy levels, increased cystathionine levels and normalized cysteine (Cys) levels.

study_design_info.masking: Quadruple (Participant, Care Provider, Investigator, Outcomes Assessor)

primary_outcome.time_frame: Through double-blind study completion, approximately 10 months per patient
primary_outcome.description: Incidence of AEs (by type, severity and relationship to study drug)

primary_outcome.time_frame: Through double-blind study completion, approximately 10 months per patient
primary_outcome.description: Presence and levels of anti-pegtibatinase antibodies in plasma as measured by antibody titers

primary_outcome.time_frame: Through double-blind study completion, approximately 10 months per patient
primary_outcome.description: Presence and levels of anti-PEG antibodies in plasma as measured by antibody titers

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Through double-blind study completion, approximately 10 months per patient
secondary_outcome.description: Changes in pegtibatinase levels following single and repeat administration at specified timepoints

secondary_outcome.measure: Changes in Met cycle metabolites levels - tHcy
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Through double-blind study completion, approximately 10 months per patient
secondary_outcome.description: Changes in total homocysteine levels in micromoles

secondary_outcome.measure: Changes in Met cycle metabolites levels - total Cys
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Through double-blind study completion, approximately 10 months per patient
secondary_outcome.description: Changes in total cysteine levels in micromoles

secondary_outcome.measure: Changes in Met cycle metabolites levels - Met
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Through double-blind study completion, approximately 10 months per patient
secondary_outcome.description: Changes in methionine levels in micromoles

secondary_outcome.measure: Changes in Met cycle metabolites levels - Cth
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Through double-blind study completion, approximately 10 months per patient
secondary_outcome.description: Changes in cystathionine levels in micromoles

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Through double-blind study completion, approximately 10 months per patient
secondary_outcome.description: Comprehensive ophthalmological examination (for each eye: visual acuity [myopia, hyperopia, exotropia], slit lamp examination [ectopic lentis, cataracts, corneal abrasion, and uveitis], retinal examination [retinal degeneration, retinal detachment, retinitis pigmentosa, uveitis)]). Assessment of presence and severity of findings.

secondary_outcome.measure: Bone densitometry using dual-energy X-ray absorptionmetry (DEXA) scans
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Through double-blind study completion, approximately 10 months per patient

secondary_outcome.measure: Cognitive assessments using the National Institutes of Health Toolbox Cognition Battery score
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Through double-blind study completion, approximately 10 months per patient

secondary_outcome.measure: Patient Reported Outcome (PRO): Quality of Life in Neurological Disorders [Neuro-QoL]
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Through double-blind study completion, approximately 10 months per patient
secondary_outcome.description: The Quality of Life in Neurological Disorders [Neuro-QoL] includes Anxiety Short Form, Depression Short Form, Satisfaction with Social Roles Short Form, Cognition Function Short Form for 18+ years of age; Anxiety Short Form, Depression Short Form, Social Relations - Interaction with Peers Short Form, and Cognitive Function Short Form for Ages 12 to 17 years old

secondary_outcome.measure: Patient Reported Outcome (PRO): Quality of Life by 36-Item Short Form Survey [SF-36]
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Through double-blind study completion, approximately 10 months per patient

secondary_outcome.measure: Patient Reported Outcome (PRO): Quality of Life by EuroQol 5-Dimentional Instrument [EQ 5D]
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Through double-blind study completion, approximately 10 months per patient

intervention.description: Pegtibatinase sterile solution for subcutaneous injection
intervention.other_name: PEG modified CBS, PEG htCBS C15S, htCBS C15S ME-200GS

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Confirmed diagnosis of homocystinuria based on genetic confirmation and plasma tHcy ≥50 micromoles and documentation of previous tHcy level ≥80 micromoles
- Willing and able to provide written, signed informed consent and to comply with all study related procedures
- Females of child-bearing potential must have a negative pregnancy test at screening and be willing to have additional pregnancy tests during the study
- Sexually active patients must be willing to use acceptable method of contraception while on the study and for 4 weeks after the end of study
- Willing to maintain a stable diet with no significant modifications while on study
- In generally good health, except for possible complications of homocystinuria
Exclusion Criteria:
- Previous exposure to pegtibatinase and/or previous participation in pegtibatinase clinical trials
- Use of any investigational product or investigational medical device within 30 days prior to Screening, or while on study
- Use or planned use of any injectable drugs containing PEG (other than pegtibatinase or COVID-19 vaccines), including medroxyprogesterone (eg, Depo-Provera) injection, within 3 months prior to Screening and during study participation
- Known hypersensitivity to PEG-containing product or any components of pegtibatinase
- A positive test for HIV antibody, hepatitis B surface antigen, or hepatitis C antibody
- A history of organ transplantation, chronic immunosuppressive therapy, or substance abuse
- Pregnant or breastfeeding at Screening or planning to become pregnant (self or partner) or to breastfeed at any time during the study
- Concurrent disease or condition or planned major surgery that would interfere with study participation or safety in the opinion of the investigator.
